block_1.heading: My skills
block_1.content: In more than 13 years of successful work in the IT industry, my technology stack has changed many times, but my technical expertise has always remained at a high level.

block_2.heading: Backend
block_2.go_content: my primary language for realizing projects of various complexity and functionality (from microservices to monoliths). It perfectly copes with a wide range of tasks for developing highly efficient backend services and has proved it many times.
block_2.python_content: my secondary language, e.g. for artificial intelligence (AI) projects or in cases where the customer is unable/willing to use Go.
block_2.n8n_content: I use this product to develop a serverless architecture and API-gateway approach, as well as to create Telegram bots.

block_3.heading: Databases
block_3.postgres_content: my primary database for storing data. Also, I use its built-in LISTEN/NOTIFY functionality and JSONB fields.
block_3.redis_content: my primary in-memory database for caching data and working with brokers (e.g. Asynq or RabbitMQ).
block_3.sqlite_content: my secondary database for simple projects and static websites where using PostgreSQL doesn't make sense.

block_4.heading: Frontend
block_4.vue_content: my primary web framework. I'm a long-time fan of it (since version 2.x), so I implement all SPA projects in Vue ecosystem (Typescript).
block_4.tailwind_content: my primary CSS framework for creating user interface. I often use it together with the daisyUI component library.
block_4.htmx_content: I always support such technologies and libraries because they allow every backend developer to become even more efficient and implement frontend logic without going outside the usual stack.
block_4.static_generators_content: my main engines for creating static websites and public documentation.
block_4.bun_content: I use this modern, incredibly fast and backwards-compatible Node.js JavaScript runtime.
block_4.vite_content: my primary tool for dev environment, creating and optimizing builds of the frontend part of the project.

block_5.heading: UX/UI design
block_5.figma_content: my primary tool for UX prototyping and creating UI design for websites and mobile apps.

block_6.heading: CI/CD and deploy tools
block_6.docker_content: I place all my Go/Python projects in Docker images for later deployment to a remote server or cloud infrastructure as isolated containers.
block_6.actions_runners_content: to automate the process of deploying and code base verification/validation.
block_6.goreleaser_content: to automate the process of building a Go project for different architectures and OS, as well as, publishing to Homebrew and Docker Hub.

block_1.heading: What am I offering?
block_1.content_1: I offer full-service collaboration to build scalable, maintainable and fault-tolerant microservices for your business in Go or Python.
block_1.content_2: Microservices are atomic units, they are independent of your development team's chosen technology stack used in other parts of your business process.
block_1.content_3: Inter Program Communication (IPC) will utilize gRPC or REST (in JSON format), making it much easier to integrate the new service into your current infrastructure.

block_2.content_1: Microservices offer a unique opportunity to start small and scale as you grow. Each service can be deployed independently, allowing you to increase resources for the most stressed parts of the system without affecting the rest.
block_2.content_2: Microservices can be developed and deployed autonomously, speeding up the process of making changes and updates. This makes them an ideal solution for any business that needs to constantly update their systems without downtime.
block_2.content_3: Microservice architecture increases the resilience of the system to failures: if one service fails, it does not affect the operation of the rest and vice versa.

block_3.heading: Examples of tasks
block_3.content: A list of some of my previously realized tasks, where the application of microservice architecture allowed to improve the customer's business metrics.

card_1.heading: Processing incoming requests (API gateway)
card_1.content: A service that integrates with various external/internal company systems, processes customer requests and returns the result in a set format.

card_2.heading: Recommendation and notification system
card_2.content: A system that sends personalized recommendations and event notifications to customers based on accumulated company data and other internal sales department metrics.

card_3.heading: System for collecting statistics and analytics
card_3.content: A system for collecting data on user interactions (on a website or mobile app) and analyzing them to produce business insights.
